unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: Telecommunications: Fiber to Home Expansion Gains Momentum Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26, 2023 - Major telecom players are significantly ramping up Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, promising faster and more reliable broadband connectivity. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, with Jio reportedly adding over 1 lakh new subscribers monthly.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth two thousand and twenty three - Major telecom players are significantly ramping up Fiber to Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India, promising faster and more reliable broadband connectivity. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, with Jio reportedly adding over one lakh new subscribers monthly.

unnormalised: This rapid expansion aims to bridge the digital divide, bringing high-speed internet to even remote areas like the Himalayan foothills. The government's 'Digital India' initiative, inspired by the ambitious spirit of Bollywood's *Swades*, is further incentivizing investment in FTTH deployment.
normalised: This rapid expansion aims to bridge the digital divide, bringing high speed internet to even remote areas like the Himalayan foothills. The government's 'Digital India' initiative, inspired by the ambitious spirit of Bollywood's *Swades*, is further incentivizing investment in F T T H deployment.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel has announced a Rs. 5,000 crore investment plan to extend its fiber network by an additional 50,000 km in FY24. The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras is collaborating with several telecom companies to develop cost-effective fiber optic solutions specifically tailored to the Indian landscape. Experts predict that FTTH penetration will reach 60% of Indian households by 2028, paving the way for enhanced e-governance, online education, and digital commerce. Concerns remain regarding right-of-way approvals and infrastructure deployment challenges in densely populated urban areas.
normalised: Bharti Airtel has announced a rupee five thousand crore investment plan to extend its fiber network by an additional fifty thousand kilometer in F Y twenty four. The Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Madras is collaborating with several telecom companies to develop cost effective fiber optic solutions specifically tailored to the Indian landscape. Experts predict that F T T H penetration will reach sixty percent of Indian households by two thousand and twenty eight, paving the way for enhanced e-governance, online education, and digital commerce. Concerns remain regarding right of way approvals and infrastructure deployment challenges in densely populated urban areas.
